intro: Knautia arvensis, commonly known as field knautia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Knautia arvensis is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
